		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h1 style="text-align: center;" class="hashtag">#itskickingoff</h1>

[countdown date="06/11/2014" time="09:00:00"]

[quotcoll orderby="random" limit=1]

<h4 style="text-align:center" class="info">It’s Kicking Off gives you easy access to information and facts about every game of the Brazil 2014 World Cup. Not only that, but we’ll aim to do it in a fun and engaging way. </h4>

[emailpickup hide_label="yes" placeholder="Enter your email"] 

<h5 style="text-align:center; text-transform: uppercase" class="sign-up-info">We’re kicking things off on Wednesday 11th June 2014.<br /> sign up here to receive news when we do.</h5>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Brazil vs Croatia</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/brazil-vs-croatia/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 Jun 2014 20:00:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=4</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>$718,299,900 </strong>Brazil boasts the <a href="http://www.nydailynews.com/sports/soccer/brazil-expensive-team-2014-world-cup-article-1.1817330" target="_blank"><span class="s1">most expensive of the 32 teams</span></a> playing in the World Cup with a roster value of $718,299,900. Honduras’ squad (the lowest ranked team in the tournament) on the other hand is valued at just $45,053,928.</p>
<p class="p1">This will be the first game in World Cup history which will feature goal line technology. It will help to eradicate mistakes such as England midfielder <a href="http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/englands-frank-lampard-still-haunted-2799885" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Frank Lampard’s disallowed goal</span></a> against Germany in the 2010 World Cup.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Just a minute</strong> Referees are set to use a <a href="http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/brazil-world-cup-vanishing-spray-2946360" target="_blank"><span class="s1">water-based vanishing spray</span></a> to mark out where the defensive wall and ball, must be stationed during free-kicks. The spray is supposed to disappear after a minute.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>9</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-12 21:00:07</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-12 20:00:07</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

	<item>
				<title>Mexico vs Cameroon</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/mexico-vs-cameroon/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 Jun 2014 16:00:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=16</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>"They're not shirts..."</strong> Will Cameroon turn up in sleeveless shirts again? FIFA forced them to change their kit in the 2002 World Cup, declaring “<a href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/africa/1862872.stm" target="_blank"><span class="s1">they’re not shirts…they’re vests</span></a>”.</p>
<p class="p1">Mexican Pop-Star ‘<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belinda_Peregr%C3%ADn" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Belinda</span></a>’ released a song about losing her virginity to Mexican forward <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giovani_dos_Santos" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Giovani Dos Santos</span></a>. And we thought the England squad were a bit promiscuous!</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1982</strong> Cameroon’s (nicknamed ‘The Lions’) <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1982_FIFA_World_Cup" target="_blank"><span class="s1">first World Cup was in 1982</span></a> after the number of teams competing increased from 16 to 24. The newcomers held both Poland and Italy to draws and were denied a place in the next round on the basis of having scored fewer goals than Italy.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>16</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-13 17:00:50</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-13 16:00:50</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>mexico-vs-cameroon</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="teams" nicename="cameroon"><![CDATA[Cameroon]]></category>
		<category domain="teams" nicename="mexico"><![CDATA[Mexico]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>teams</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:2:{i:0;i:12;i:1;i:34;}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_teams</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_538db5a7650b6]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>

	<item>
				<title>Spain vs Netherlands</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/spain-vs-netherlands/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 Jun 2014 19:00:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=18</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>2010</strong> The last time these two teams met was in the </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_Final" target="_blank"><span class="s2">2010 World Cup final</span></a><span class="s1">. </span>It was the second consecutive all-European final, and marked the first time a European team has won the trophy outside Europe.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>0%</strong> The Netherlands have been to the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup" target="_blank"><span class="s1">World Cup Final</span></a> three times (1974, 1978 and 2010) with a success rate of 0%.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Bless</strong> Fernando Torres started out as a goalkeeper until he lost his two front teeth making a save and his <a href="http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/torres-my-mum-stopped-me-being-goalkeeper" target="_blank"><span class="s1">mum wouldn’t let him play in goal anymore</span></a>. Ah. Bless.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Chile vs Australia</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/chile-vs-australia/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 Jun 2014 22:00:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=20</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>40ºC</strong> Arena Pantanal in scorching hot Cuiaba, is <a href="http://www.weather.com/weather/tenday/Cuiaba+Brazil+BRXX0078" target="_blank"><span class="s1">one of the hottest cities in Brazil</span></a> with temperatures rising above 40ºC in summer months. Scorchio!</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1994</strong> Chile were banned by FIFA from entering the World Cup in 1994 due to their goalkeeper <span class="s1"><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roberto_Rojas" target="_blank">Roberto Antonio "Cóndor" Rojas Saavedra</a> </span>faking an injury. He even used fake blood to try and have the qualifying game abandoned.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>G'day mate</strong> The Australian football team are nicknamed <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/jun/05/how-socceroos-can-win-world-cup" target="_blank">‘<span class="s1">The Socceroos</span>’</a> (for obvious reasons). They face a difficult challenge getting out of the "group of death" including Spain, Holland and Chile.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Columbia vs Greece</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/columbia-vs-greece/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 14 Jun 2014 16:00:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=22</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>2004</strong> Greece’s coach <a href="http://equaliserblog.wordpress.com/2010/08/09/17-rehhagel/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Otto Rehhagel</span></a> likes his players to man-mark. So much so that he has said: "I want to know the aftershave used by every player in Europe." Otto's tactics might be strange but he took Greece to the Euro 2004 finals and won.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>Coffee?</strong> Greece have been known to stage some </span>bizarre bonding sessions, including staying up the night before big games drinking coffee.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>30 points</strong> Colombia had their <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25192077" target="_blank"><span class="s1">best run ever leading</span></a> up to the finals, with a haul of 30 points from 16 games, beating Uruguay 4-0 and Chile 3-1. Unfortunately, the man who helped them get there, Radamel Falcao, will not be joining them as he hasn't <a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/worldcup2014/article-2646679/Falcao-left-Colombia-World-Cup-squad.html" target="_blank">recovered fully from injury</a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>22</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-14 17:00:08</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-14 16:00:08</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>columbia-vs-greece</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<category domain="teams" nicename="greece"><![CDATA[Greece]]></category>

			<wp:meta_key>teams</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:2:{i:0;i:14;i:1;i:27;}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

	<item>
				<title>Uruguay vs Costa Rica</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/uruguay-vs-costa-rica/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 14 Jun 2014 19:00:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=24</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>1930</strong> E</span>very match at the inaugural <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1930_FIFA_World_Cup" target="_blank"><span class="s2">1930 World Cup in Uruguay</span></a> was played in one city, Montevideo. Uruguay were selected to host the games as the country would be celebrating the centenary of its first constitution.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>56 secs</strong> Uruguay's Jose Batista was shown a red card a mere 56 seconds into a first-round game against Scotland at the 1986 World Cup, <a href="http://www.espnfc.com/story/1470654" target="_blank"><span class="s1">the fastest sending off in the tournaments history</span></a>.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>1000/1</strong> </span>Costa Rica’s greatest ever player is <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paulo_Wanchope" target="_blank">Paolo Wanchope</a>. They’re <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/10498171/Costa-Rica-World-Cup-2014-team-guide.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">odds of winning the title are 1000/1</span></a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>England vs Italy</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/england-vs-italy/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 14 Jun 2014 22:00:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=26</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>46,000</strong> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arena_da_Amaz%C3%B4nia" target="_blank">Arena Amazonia</a></span> in Manaus is a 46,000 capacity stadium set in the heart of the Amazon Rainforest. It’ll play host to four games over the course of the World Cup.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>24x </strong>England and Italy have met <a href="http://www.11v11.com/teams/italy/tab/opposingTeams/opposition/England" target="_blank"><span class="s1">24 times</span></a> since first playing in 1933. England have won 10, drawn 6 and lost 8.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1938</strong> After winning their second World Cup title in 1938, Italy went on a 44 year drought before winning their third title in 1982. <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy_national_football_team" target="_blank"><span class="s1">The Italians are the second most successful national team in the history of the World Cup</span></a>, having won titles in 1934, 1938, 1982, 2006. Only Brazil have won more (5).</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Switzerland vs Ecuador</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/switzerland-vs-ecuador/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 15 Jun 2014 16:00:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=28</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>140</strong> The highest scoring game in World Cup history was in 1954, when Austria defeated Switzerland 7-5. With an average of five goals a game, the <a href="http://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/worldcup/switzerland1954/index.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">1954 World Cup in Switzerland</span></a> became the highest scoring in history (140 goals in 26 matches).</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>2006</strong> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador_national_football_team" target="_blank">Ecuador</a></span> has qualified for three World Cup finals in 2002, 2006 and 2014. Their best performance came in 2006 when they advanced to the Round of 16, eventually eliminated by England.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>0</strong> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_E" target="_blank">Ecuador and Switzerland</a></span> have never met in the World Cup before.</p>
<p class="p1"></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>28</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-15 17:00:39</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-15 16:00:39</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>switzerland-vs-ecuador</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="teams" nicename="ecuador"><![CDATA[Ecuador]]></category>

			<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_key>teams</wp:meta_key>

	<item>
				<title>Ivory Coast vs Japan</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/ivorycoast-vs-japan/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 15 Jun 2014 01:00:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=85</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>12 <span class="s1">cities</span></strong> </span>This 2014 World Cup in Brazil will witness matches taking place in <a href="http://www.stadiumguide.com/tournaments/fifa-world-cup-2014/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">12 different cities</span></a> – more than any other World Cup.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong><span style="color: #333333;">Les Éléphants</span> </strong>Despite being hailed as the best team in Africa, Ivory Coast, nicknamed <span style="color: #545454;">Les Éléphants,</span> have never made it past the group stages of the World Cup. Yaya Toure, Didier Drogba and co will be looking to <a href="http://www.euronews.com/2014/06/04/world-cup-2014-ivory-coast-bidding-to-make-history/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">make history in Brazil</span></a>.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>Big in Asia</strong> The </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_national_football_team" target="_blank"><span class="s2">Japanese football team</span></a> is one of the most successful in Asia having qualified for the last five consecutive World Cup finals with second round advancements in 2002 and 2010 and having won the AFC Asian Cup a record four times (1992, 2000, 2004 &amp; 2011).</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>France vs Honduras</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/france-vs-honduras/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 15 Jun 2014 19:00:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=92</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>1-0</strong> With France trailing Mexico 1-0 in their second game of the 1930 World Cup finals, <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/sport/blog/2010/jul/02/joy-six-world-cup-refereeing-controversies" target="_blank"><span class="s1">referee Almeida Rego</span></a> blew up for full time with a French forward clear through on goal and six minutes remaining on the clock.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1966</strong> Uruguay's 2-1 win over France at the 1966 World Cup was played at <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_City_Stadium" target="_blank"><span class="s1">White City Stadium</span></a>, Shepherds Bush because Wembley was already booked for a greyhound race night.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>0</strong> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_E" target="_blank">France and Honduras</a></span> have never met in the World Cup before.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>92</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-15 20:00:11</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-15 19:00:11</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>france-vs-honduras</wp:post_name>

	<item>
				<title>Argentina vs Bosnia &amp; Herzegovina</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/argentina-vs-bosnia-herzegovina/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 15 Jun 2014 22:00:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=95</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>£161.5m</strong> Little Argentinian Lionel Messi is the World Cups MVP <a href="http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9337315/lionel-messi-cristiano-ronaldo-and-luis-suarez-named-worlds-most-valuable-players" target="_blank">(<span class="s1">Most Valuable Player</span>)</a> with an estimated value of £161.5m, almost double that of the Portugal star Christiano Ronaldo (£85.2m).</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1978</strong> Argentina was the last South American country to stage the World Cup, in <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1978_FIFA_World_Cup" target="_blank"><span class="s1">1978</span>.</a></p>
<p class="p1">After missing out on qualification for the 2010 World Cup and Euro 2012 at the play-off stage to Portugal on both occasions, <a href="http://forzaitalianfootball.com/2014/06/world-cup-2014-preview-bosnia-and-herzegovina/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Bosnia and Herezegovina will be making an appearance</span></a> at the finals of a major tournament for the first time in their history in Brazil.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>95</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-15 23:00:11</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-15 22:00:11</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>argentina-vs-bosnia-herzegovina</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="teams" nicename="argentina"><![CDATA[Argentina]]></category>
		<category domain="teams" nicename="bosnia-herzgovina"><![CDATA[Bosnia &amp; Herzgovina]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorised"><![CDATA[Uncategorised]]></category>

	<item>
				<title>Info</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/info/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Jun 2014 19:57:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?page_id=230</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1">Being ardent football fans, we were frustrated
by the lack of design-led sites that served up easily accessible match info and facts surrounding the World Cup. Our aim was to create a web app that was not only visually engaging, but fun. We wanted to create a place where football fans could gain access to important match info and interesting, fun facts about the history of the competition.</p>
<p class="p1">We will be updating the site with final scores and points tallies as the games finish, so you can keep fully abreast of all the group stage and knock-out games at the 2014 Brazil World Cup.</p>
<p class="p1">If you’d like to receive information on any future projects,
please sign up to our mailing list. Thanks.</p>
<small class="small sub-head dark bold">This Project has been designed and organised by <a title="Fiasco Design" href="http://fiascodesign.co.uk" target="_blank">FiascoDesign</a></small>
<div id="mc_embed_signup"><form id="mc-embedded-subscribe-form" class="validate" action="http://fiascodesign.us2.list-manage1.com/subscribe/post?u=f83fe61b8a9a5baa7b8a495a7&amp;id=f1892e4e60" method="post" name="mc-embedded-subscribe-form" novalidate="" target="_blank"><input id="mce-EMAIL" class="email" name="EMAIL" required="" type="email" value="" placeholder="email address" />
<div style="position: absolute; left: -5000px;"><input tabindex="-1" name="b_f83fe61b8a9a5baa7b8a495a7_f1892e4e60" type="text" value="" /></div>
<input id="mc-embedded-subscribe" class="cta right-corners" name="subscribe" type="submit" value="SEND!" />

</form></div>
&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Landing</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/landing/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Jun 2014 19:57:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?page_id=232</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span xml:lang="EN-GB">Want to know all the latest scores or group standings? Not sure who</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB"> Sardar Azmoun is </span><span xml:lang="EN-GB">or which top Spanish striker used to be a goalkeeper</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB">? </span>

<span xml:lang="EN-GB">It's Kicking Off</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB"> provides</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB"> vital</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB"> </span><span xml:lang="EN-GB">match information (g</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB">roups, dates, times, venues and scores)</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB">, as well as lots of weird and wonderful facts about the players, </span><span xml:lang="EN-GB">teams, venues</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB"> and the</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB"> history of the World Cup</span><span xml:lang="EN-GB">. </span>

Get match info for every game at the Brazil World Cup straight to your desktop or mobile and impress your friends with your unquestionable World Cup knowledge.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Germany vs Portugal</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/germany-vs-portugal/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 16 Jun 2014 16:00:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=30</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>3x</strong> Germany have been to the final of the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_G" target="_blank"><span class="s1">World Cup seven times</span></a> and won the trophy 3 times (1954, 1974 and 1990). This will be their 100th World Cup game.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1966</strong> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Portugal</span>’s</a> first World Cup appearance was in the 1966 FIFA World Cup, in which they reached the semi-finals, losing 2–1 at Wembley to the eventual world champions, England.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>3-1</strong> Germany and Portugal have only meet once in the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" target="_blank"><span class="s1">2006 World Cup</span></a>. It was a runners-up match and Germany beat Portugal 3-1.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Belgium vs Algeria</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/belgium-vs-algeria/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 17 Jun 2014 16:00:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=32</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>1930</strong> Belgium's <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Langenus" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Jean Langenus</span></a> was the referee in the 1930 Argentina v Uruguay Final.  He wore plus fours, a tie and a deerstalker hat. Obviously.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>1994</strong> <a href="http://andrzejpavlov.hubpages.com/hub/Belgiums-15-Best-Footballers-of-All-Time" target="_blank">Belgian goalkeeper Paul Preud'homme</a></span> used to wear a shirt of Standard Liege (his first club) under his national jersey during international matches. He had to abandon this tradition in the 1994 USA World Cup because of the heat.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>0</strong> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_H" target="_blank">Belgium and Algeria</a></span> have never meet in the World Cup before.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>

	<item>
				<title>Australia vs Netherlands</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/australia-vs-netherlands/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Jun 2014 16:00:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=34</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>31-0</strong> <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/2001/apr/12/newsstory.sport3" target="_blank">Australia defeated American Samoa</a> 31-0</span> in 2001, the largest margin of victory ever in a World Cup qualifying game. They smashed the previous record for the most amount of goals scored, also set by the Socceroos, against Tonga (22-0) just 48 hours earlier.</p>
<p class="p1">Netherlands, Czechoslovakia and Hungary are the most successful teams to have never won the tournament. They’ve all made two finals but never won the World Cup.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>3x</strong> Australia and Netherlands have never meet in a World Cup before. In all international matches <a href="http://www.11v11.com/teams/netherlands/tab/opposingTeams/opposition/Australia" target="_blank"><span class="s1">the teams have only meet 3 times</span></a> of which Australia have won 0, drawn 2 and lost 1.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>34</wp:post_id>

	<item>
				<title>Columbia vs Cote D&#039;ivoire</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/columbia-vs-cote-divoire/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 Jun 2014 16:00:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=36</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>Virgin</strong> Google </span><span class="s2"><a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/10497798/Colombia-World-Cup-2014-team-guide.html" target="_blank">translates the Colombian national anthe</a>m</span><span class="s1"> as follows: “</span>The virgin her hairs starts in agony, widow and his love cypress hangs. Regretting her hope covering cold headstone but glorious pride her fair complexion”.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1994</strong> In 1994, as one of the favourites to win, <a href="http://www.independent.co.uk/news/colombias-owngoal-star-shot-dead-1418013.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Andres Escobar</span></a> (no relation to the cartel boss Pablo Escobar) was murdered after his own goal helped eliminate Colombia from the USA World Cup.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Yaya Toure</strong> The Ivory Coast boasts an <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/10497327/Ivory-Coast-World-Cup-2014-team-guide.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">impressive line up</span></a> of European stars including Didier Drogba (Galatasary), Yaya Toure (Manchester City), Kolo Toure (Liverpool), Cheick Tiote (Newcastle), Arouna Kone (Everton) and Wilfred Bony (Swansea).</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Iran vs Nigeria</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/iran-vs-nigeria/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 16 Jun 2014 19:00:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=100</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>37th</strong> The national football team of Iran, known as <i>‘Team Melli’ </i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Rankings" target="_blank"><span class="s1">ranks 1st in Asia and 37th in the world</span></a> according to the May 2014 Fifa World Rankings.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>100,000</strong> <a href="http://www.thenational.ae/world/middle-east/sanctions-bite-into-irans-football-world-cup-dreams" target="_blank">Iranians love football</a></span> and, with most other forms of recreation restricted by strict Islamic laws, sports take on added significance. Tehran’s Azadi stadium, with the capacity of more than 100,000, regularly sells out.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Match fixing</strong> Nigeria are at the heart of alleged match-fixing prior to the 2010 World Cup in South Africa. They haven’t been helped by the goalkeeper Austin Ejide who appeared to <a href="http://sports.nationalpost.com/2014/06/01/did-nigerias-goalkeeper-throw-the-ball-in-his-own-goal/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">throw the ball into his own net</span></a> in a friendly match against Scotland.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>100</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-16 20:00:17</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-16 19:00:17</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>iran-vs-nigeria</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="teams" nicename="iran"><![CDATA[Iran]]></category>
		<category domain="teams" nicename="nigeria"><![CDATA[Nigeria]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorised"><![CDATA[Uncategorised]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>teams</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:2:{i:0;i:30;i:1;i:36;}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_teams</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_538db5a7650b6]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

	<item>
				<title>Ghana vs USA</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/ghana-vs-usa/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 16 Jun 2014 22:00:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=104</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>1930</strong> During the 1930 World Cup in Uruguay <a href="http://www.rsssf.com/tables/30f-hattrick.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">American Bert Patenaude</span></a> became the first player ever to score a hat-trick.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Black Stars</strong> Ghana aka the <a href="http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/teams/team=43860/" target="_blank">‘<span class="s1">Black Stars</span>’</a> did not qualify for the World Cup until 2006 but the team has won the Africa Cup of Nations four times (in 1963, 1965, 1978 and 1982) and been runners-up four times. At the 2010 World Cup they became only the third African team to reach the World Cup quarter finals.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>2-1</strong> Ghana and USA have <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_G" target="_blank"><span class="s1">meet in both of the last two World Cups</span></a>. Ghana have won both of their meetings 2-1.</p>
<p class="p1"></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Brazil vs Mexico</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/brazil-vs-mexico/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 17 Jun 2014 19:00:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=110</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Pele</strong> Brazilian legend <span class="s1">Pele (real name: Edson Arantes do Nascimento)</span><a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/10874465/How-and-why-Peles-mystique-and-reputation-as-the-worlds-greatest-ever-footballer-has-been-overhyped.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1"> is regarded by many as the best player of all time</span></a>. He is also the only player to win three World Cups: in 1958, 1962 and 1970.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1986</strong> Mexico became the first repeat host of the World Cup when it <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup" target="_blank"><span class="s1">staged the competition for the second time in 1986</span></a>. Colombia had been originally chosen to host the competition but due to economic reasons, was not able to do so and so officially resigned.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>3x</strong> Brazil and Mexico have meet three times in previous World Cups (1950, 1954 and 1962). Brazil have won all three 4-0, 5-0 and 2-0.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Korea Republic vs Russia</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/korearepublic-vs-russia/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 17 Jun 2014 22:00:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=114</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>72 Years</strong> It took 72 years for the World Cup to be hosted in an Asian country. When it finally took place in 2002, the spoils were shared by <a href="http://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/worldcup/koreajapan2002/index.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Japan and South Korea</span></a> (Korea Republic).</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>2018</strong> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia_national_football_team" target="_blank">Russia have qualified for three World Cups</a></span> (1994, 2002, 2014) and will host one in 2018. Euro 2008 is the first time the Russians have passed the group stages of a major tournament.</p>
<p class="p1">Former Monaco striker Park will be going to his <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27321684" target="_blank"><span class="s1">third World Cup with Japan</span></a>, despite having only played for Arsenal once and twice for Watford during a loan spell this season.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Spain vs Chile</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/spain-vs-chile/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Jun 2014 19:00:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=120</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>The Madman</strong> </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcelo_Bielsa" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Chilean coach Marcelo Bielsa</span></a><span class="s2">, known as El Loco (‘The Madman’), once gave a four-hour press conference. </span>He is known for watching and collecting numerous football videos to the point of obsession. John Carlin, an English journalist, has stated that Bielsa "has the most cultured library of soccer in the world."</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Unlucky mate</strong> Spanish goalkeeper Santiago Canizares was ruled out of the 2002 World Cup finals in May of that year, when the first-choice stopper <a href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport3/worldcup2002/hi/team_pages/spain/newsid_1994000/1994707.stm" target="_blank"><span class="s1">dropped a bottle of aftershave in his hotel bathroom and a shard of glass cut the tendon in his big toe</span></a>. "I do not consider myself to be unlucky by any manner of means," Canizares said.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>2x</strong> Spain have played Chile <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_B" target="_blank"><span class="s1">only twice in the World Cup</span></a>. Once in 1950 when Spain won 2-0 and again in 2010 when the Spanish side won 2-1.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Cameroon vs Croatia</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/cameroon-vs-croatia/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Jun 2014 22:00:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=124</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Pygmy World Cup</strong> Cameroon legend Roger Milla is said to have been arrested in 1992 after his plan to organise a <a href="http://blogs.loughboroughecho.net/goaltastic/2010/06/pygmy-world-cup.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Pygmy World Cup</span></a> drew only a handful of spectators to the country's 50,000-seat Omnisports Stadium. By the third day, the disgruntled Pygmies from local rain forests, were complaining about being locked in a guarded room underneath the ground with only one meal of rice and sauce in 72 hours. "You don't know the pygmies. They are extremely difficult to control. They play better if they don't eat too much," argued the spokesman."</p>
<p class="p1"><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_A" target="_blank">Cameroon and Croatia</a> have never meet in a World Cup before.</p>
<p class="p1"></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Uruguay vs England</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/uruguay-vs-england/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 Jun 2014 19:00:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=130</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>3x Yellow Cards</strong> It was the English referee Graham Poll who mistakenly showed Croatian defender Josip Simunic <a href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2006/5108722.stm" target="_blank"><span class="s1">three yellow cards</span></a> during a first-round game against Australia in 2006. Whoops.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>56 Seconds</strong> Uruguay's <a href="http://www.espnfc.com/story/1470654" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Jose Batista was shown a red card</span></a> a mere 56 seconds into a first-round game against Scotland at the 1986 World Cup, the fastest sending off in tournament history.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1966</strong> The opening match of the <a href="http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/row-zed/9-surprising-facts-1966-world-3639077" target="_blank"><span class="s1">1966 tournament</span></a>, against Uruguay, was delayed because seven England players had left their FIFA registration cards back at the team hotel.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Japan vs Greece</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/japan-vs-greece/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 Jun 2014 22:00:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=132</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>158</strong> The <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hymn_to_Liberty" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Greek national anthem is a 158-verse poem set to music</span></a>. It is the longest national anthem in the world. In 1865, the first three stanzas and later the first two officially became the national anthem of Greece and the Republic of Cyprus.</p>
<p class="p1">Japan have employed some <a href="http://babb.telegraph.co.uk/2014/05/training-japan-style/?var=rm&amp;utm_expid=85116113-1.XkUSa1kmSmau_OlJDn55HQ.1&amp;utm_referrer=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Ffootball%2Fshortcuts%2F2014%2Fmay%2F21%2Ftraining-japans-national-football-team" target="_blank"><span class="s1">strange training techniques</span></a> in preparation for the start of the World Cup.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>132</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-19 23:00:35</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-19 22:00:35</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>japan-vs-greece</wp:post_name>

	<item>
				<title>Italy vs Costa Rica</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/italy-vs-costa-rica/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Jun 2014 16:00:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=137</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Dino Zoff</strong> Italian <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dino_Zoff" target="_blank"><span class="s1">goalkeeper Dino Zoff</span></a> was forty years old when he became the oldest player ever to win the World Cup, at the 1982 tournament in Spain.</p>
<p class="p1">Italy <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/italy/1523907/World-Cup-suffers-at-hands-of-the-winners.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">broke the World Cup</span></a> soon after receiving it in 2006. A large piece of the green malachite which surrounds the base was chipped off during their victory celebrations.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>4x</strong> Costa Rica are the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Costa_Rica_national_football_team" target="_blank"><span class="s1">most successful team in Central America</span></a> having qualified for four World Cups, including reaching the last sixteen on their debut in Italy 1990. In 2006, Costa Rica qualified for the World Cup in Germany, with their worst World Cup to date, finishing 31st out of 32 teams.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Switzerland vs France</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/switzerland-vs-france/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Jun 2014 19:00:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=140</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Handball!</strong> Ireland asked FIFA to let it enter the 2010 World Cup as the tournament's 33rd team after <a href="http://www.theweek.co.uk/football/thierry-henry/18377/%E2%80%98hand-frog%E2%80%99-goal-now-international-incident" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Thierry Henry's infamous handball</span></a> helped France qualify for the competition at the expense of the Irish. Their request was denied!</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>2006</strong> Zinedine Zidane, one of the greatest soccer players ever, is remembered for his last ever act on a soccer field during 2006 World Cup when he head butted Marco Materazzi in the chest which led to a red card as well as a farewell to professional soccer.</p>
<p class="p1"><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Switzerland_national_football_team#mediaviewer/File:SFV_Logo.svg" target="_blank">Switzerlands logo</a>, ASF-SFV, represents the Swiss Football Association's initials in Switzerland's official languages: ASF represents both French (<i>Association Suisse de Football</i>) and Italian (<i>Associazione Svizzera di Football</i>), and SFV is German (<i>Schweizerischer Fussballverband</i>). In<span class="s1"> Romash, </span>the association is abbreviated as ASB (<i>Associaziun Svizra da Ballape</i>).</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Honduras vs Ecuador</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/honduras-vs-ecuador/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Jun 2014 22:00:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=143</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Evil spirits</strong> In 2006, <a href="http://www.itnsource.com/fr/specials/world-cup-brazil/shotlist//RTV/2006/04/28/RTV712206/" target="_blank">Ecuadorian shaman </a>Tzamarenda Naychapi was allowed to "purify" each German stadium by letting out a loud scream to chase away evil spirits.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Goal!!!</strong> The Honduran roster consists of a few Premier League players but the most notable is Hull City defender Maynor Figueroa. The former Wigan player’s amazing goal from his own half against Stoke at the Britannia Stadium was voted as Goal of the Season four years ago.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1500/1</strong> Honduras departed the last World Cup in South Africa failing to win a single game or score a goal. They’ve never been past the group stages. They're 1500/1 to win.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Argentina vs Iran</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/argentina-vs-iran/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 21 Jun 2014 16:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=145</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>1934</strong> Argentinian <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Monti" target="_blank">Luis Monti</a> who was born in Buenos Aries is the only person to have played in two World Cup finals for different countries, representing Italy in 1934 after playing for Argentina four years earlier.

<strong>Iranian Messi</strong> One to watch out for in the Iranian team is Sardar Azmoun. Son of an international volleyball player, he made his Iranian league debut at 15 and has been labelled as the “<a href="http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/sardar-azmoun-transfer-arsenal-liverpool-3593434" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Iranian Messi</span></a>”.
<p class="p1"><strong>Hand of God </strong>Argentina knocked England out of the quarter finals in the 1986 World Cup in Mexico, courtesy of <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26696506" target="_blank"><span class="s1">one of the most controversial goals in World Cup history</span></a>. In the 51st minute Diego Maradona scored with his hand. The goal has gone down as the ‘Hand of God’.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>145</wp:post_id>

	<item>
				<title>Germany vs Ghana</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/germany-vs-ghana/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 21 Jun 2014 19:00:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=147</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>7x</strong> Only Brazil have made the same number appearances in World Cup finals as Germany. Both have appeared seven times but <a href="http://www.thesoccerworldcups.com/head_to_head/brazil_vs_germany.php" target="_blank"><span class="s1">they’ve only met once</span></a> (the World Cup final in 2002) which Brazil won 2-0.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Sexy time</strong> Ghana’s Kevin Prince-Boateng has a private jet, 15 tattoos and a poor injury record caused, according to his fiancee, by the <a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2090651/Kevin-Prince-Boatengs-sex-life-blamed-injury-curse.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">couples nocturnal workouts</span>.</a></p>
<p class="p1"><strong>2010</strong> Germany and Ghana have only met once in previous World Cups. They were <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_D" target="_blank"><span class="s1">drawn in the same group in 2010</span></a> and Germany won 1-0.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Nigeria vs Bosnia &amp; Herzegovina</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/nigeria-vs-bosnia-herzegovina/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 21 Jun 2014 22:00:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=149</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>79-0</strong> The Nigerian Football Federation were forced to ban players and officials of Plateau United Feeders and Police Machine FC of <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23412227" target="_blank"><span class="s1">suspected match-fixing</span></a> after they recorded wins of 79-0 and 67-0 respectively.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Maradona-esque</strong> Bosnian <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/apr/28/roma-miralem-pjanic-wonder-goal-milan" target="_blank"><span class="s1">playmaker Miralem Pjanic</span></a> scored what his Roma coach Rudi Garcia called a “Maradona-esque” goal against Milan in April. “It should be seen all over the world” said Garcia.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>3.8m</strong> This is <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bosnia_and_Herzegovina" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Bosnia and Herzegovina</span>’s</a> first outing to the World Cup. With one of the smallest populations of any of the teams at this years competition (3.8m), the Bosnians are 150-1 to win the tournament.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Belgium vs Russia</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/belgium-vs-russia/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 22 Jun 2014 16:00:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=151</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>6-1</strong> Russia's <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EVU4F--vCzI" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Oleg Salenko scored a tournament-record five goals</span></a> in one game during a 6-1 win over Cameroon at the 1994 World Cup in the United States. A record which he still holds to this day.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Trout fishing</strong> The Paradise Golf and Lake Resort where the Belgium team will be staying during the World Cup have <a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2559466/Revealed-Secret-World-Cup-success-relax-team-fishing-says-Wilmots.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">stocked a lake with trout</span></a> so that the squad can enjoy a spot of fishing to relax.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Hands Up!</strong> Russian goalkeeper Igor Akinfeev has recorded several songs with popular <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruki_Vverh!" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Russian pop group Ruki Vverh</span>!</a> The name means Hands Up!</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>151</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-22 17:00:10</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-22 16:00:10</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>belgium-vs-russia</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>feature_0_object</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<p class="p1">Video for Russian pop group Ruki Vverh! single Pesenka (La La La):</p>

	<item>
				<title>Korea Republic vs Algeria</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/korea-republic-vs-algeria/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 22 Jun 2014 19:00:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=153</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Warriors</strong> South Korea are also known as the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea_national_football_team" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Taeguk Warriors</span></a>. Taegeuk is the symbol in the middle of the South Korea flag and translates literally as “large eternity”.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>11.2 Shots</strong> South Koreans drink the equivalent of <a href="http://time.com/6616/south-koreans-slam-down-11-2-shots-of-hard-liquor-each-week/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">11.2 shots of hard alcohol per week</span></a>, more than twice as much as the next most spirit-friendly county, Russia.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Pain in the arse</strong> During a nine-club, two-country career, Algerian coach <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jan/24/vahid-halihodzic-africa-cup-of-nations-algeria" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Vahid Halilhodzic</span>’s</a> confrontational style has led to numerous fallouts including, a two-month ban for abusing a referee. He once also accidentally shot himself in the arse.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>USA vs Portugal</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/usa-vs-portugal/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 22 Jun 2014 22:00:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=155</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Hat-trick</strong> Portugal qualified for the 2014 World Cup with a 3-2 win over Sweden in Stockholm. <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/nov/19/sweden-v-portugal-live-world-cup-play-off-report" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Christiano Ronaldo scored all three goals</span></a> on the night to send Portugal to Brazil.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>D'OH</strong> In a recent <a href="http://metro.co.uk/2014/04/01/the-simpsons-predict-germany-will-win-world-cup-in-brazil-and-homer-will-referee-the-final-4684891/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Simpsons World Cup special</span></a>, Homer travels to South America to referee the final. Germany beat Brazil 2-0.</p>
<p class="p1">The USA spent their <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/06/jurgen-klinsmann-usa-coach-world-cup" target="_blank"><span class="s1">January break in Brazil</span></a> at the hotel and training centre they will use for the World Cup.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Netherlands vs Chile</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/netherlands-vs-chile/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jun 2014 16:00:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=157</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>1978</strong> Holland great Johan Cruyff <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/2008/apr/16/newsstory.sport15" target="_blank"><span class="s1">missed the 1978 finals</span></a>, with the Dutch FA originally claiming it was down to his distaste for the junta in Argentina. But 30 years later it was revealed Cruyff had pulled out because of worries over family security following a kidnap attempt. He said: "Someone had a rifle at my head and tied me up and tied up my wife in front of the children at our flat in Barcelona”.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>7-1</strong> It took Chile until their <a href="http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football-chile--10-fascinating-footballing-facts-1144179.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">34th international</span></a> to register their first victory. They made up for lost time though, with a 7-1 win over Bolivia in 1926.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>Goal! </strong><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robin_van_Persie" target="_blank">Robin Van Persie</a></span> topped the European qualifying scoring charts with 11 goals and, in total, has 42 goals in 83 appearances for the <i>Oranje</i>.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>157</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-23 17:00:26</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-23 16:00:26</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

	<item>
				<title>Australia vs Spain</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/australia-vs-spain/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jun 2014 16:00:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=159</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>750-1 to win</strong> Spain are the </span><a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/10835958/World-Cup-2014-countries-Fifa-world-rankings.html" target="_blank"><span class="s2">highest-ranked participating nation</span></a> and are reigning champions. Australia are the lowest (59) and 750-1 to win.</p>
<p class="p1">A <a href="http://www.guy-sports.com/world_cup_football/football_stupid.htm" target="_blank"><span class="s1">mugger who stole Eva Standmann's handbag</span></a> before the Brazil - Australia game in Munich eight years ago, found her ticket in her bag and decided to enjoy the game. Unfortunately he sat in Eva's seat next to her husband Berndt, who had him arrested. D’oh.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Vincent del Bosque</strong> Spanish coach <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vicente_del_Bosque#Manager" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Vincente del Bosque</span></a> has one of the best records of all the coaches involved: Two league titles and two European Cups with Real Madrid. A World Cup (2010) and a European Championship (2012) with Spain. Not bad.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Cameroon vs Brazil</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/cameroon-vs-brazil/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jun 2014 20:00:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=162</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>1958</strong> Brazil’s <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%A1rio_Zagallo" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Mario Zagallo</span></a> became the first man to win the World Cup as a player and a coach. He won his first title while playing for Brazil in 1958.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Brazuca</strong> The official match ball, made by Adidas, is named ‘<a href="http://www.adidas.co.uk/brazuca-official-match-ball/G73617_720.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Brazuca</span></a>’ created from pulling (Brazilian + Bazooka) together. The name was chosen through a public vote.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1990</strong> Cameroon will for ever be part of World cup folklore owing to their <a href="http://http://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/feb/12/world-cup-25-stunning-moments-cameroon-argentina" target="_blank"><span class="s1">shock victory over holders Argentina</span></a> in 1990, <a href="http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/90-ciao-gazzas-tears-schillacis-skills-and-milla-corner-flag" target="_blank">Milla’s corner-flag jigs</a> and their participation in a quarter-final victory for England.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Croatia vs Mexico</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/croatia-vs-mexico/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jun 2014 20:00:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=164</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>22 Games</strong> <a href="http://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/statisticsandrecords/associations/association=mex/worldcup/" target="_blank">Mexico</a></span> have lost 22 games in their 14 World Cup appearances. They also have the worst goal differential, allowing 36 more than they have scored overall.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>3-0</strong> Croatias best finish in a World Cup was in the <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zpHIQqLzZVo" target="_blank"><span class="s1">France 1998 World Cup</span></a> when they finished 3rd behind Brazil and France. France beat Brazil 3-0 in the final.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Smoking gun</strong> Mexico coach <a href="http://www.espnfc.com/story/370838" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Ricardo Lavolpe was warned by FIFA during the 2006 World Cup</span></a> after cameras caught him chain-smoking in the dugout. The former Argentine international had a magnificent tournament, calling journalists "fucking idiots" and spending much of his time at the team's training sessions eating doughnuts under a roped-off parasol.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Italy vs Uruguay</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/italy-vs-uruguay/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Jun 2014 16:00:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=167</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Why always me?</strong> Italian forward <span class="s1"><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_Balotelli" target="_blank">Mario Balotell</a>i</span> notched up nearly as many yellow and red cards as goals last season: 14 bookings, one sending off, 18 strikes for Milan.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>200,000</strong> The biggest ever attendance for a World Cup match was recorded in 1950. <a href="http://www.fifa.com/classicfootball/matches/world-cup/match=1190/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">200,000 people</span></a> squeezed into the Maracana Stadium in Brazil for the final between Brazil and Uruguay. Uruguay won 2-1.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1938</strong> The string in Italy captain <a href="http://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/worldcup/uruguay1930/index.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Peppino Meazza's shorts broke just before he took a vital penalty</span></a> in the 1938 semi-final against Brazil. He took the kick while holding them up, then let them drop as he was mobbed by delighted team-mates.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>167</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-24 17:00:25</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-24 16:00:25</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>italy-vs-uruguay</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="teams" nicename="italy"><![CDATA[Italy]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorised"><![CDATA[Uncategorised]]></category>
		<category domain="teams" nicename="uruguay"><![CDATA[Uruguay]]></category>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>

			<wp:meta_key>teams</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:2:{i:0;i:31;i:1;i:41;}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_teams</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_538db5a7650b6]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>score_1</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_score_1</wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>score_2</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_score_2</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_538dfbffeb030]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>venue</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Estadio das Dunas]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_venue</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_538f06eb727a5]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>feature</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_feature</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_53904edf2720a]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>feature_0_object</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<p class="p1">A short film about the 1950 final:</p>
<iframe src="//www.youtube.com/embed/t29i1CdHdNM" width="420" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[https://www.google.co.uk/maps/place/Est%C3%A1dio+Arena+das+Dunas/@-5.826827,-35.21243,1138m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x7b2ff8a13881441:0x67b68f5b518ceff4]]></wp:meta_value>

	<item>
				<title>Costa Rica vs England</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/costa-rica-vs-england/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Jun 2014 16:00:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=171</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>1966</strong> Just before the World Cup took place in England in 1966, the trophy was mysteriously stolen. <a href="http://www.channel4.com/news/world-cup-england-1966-pickles-the-dog-archive-itn" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Luckily a dog named ‘Pickles’ discovered it</span></a> wrapped up in newspaper under a bush when on a walk with his owner. Good boy!</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>4-2</strong> England's Geoff Hurst is the only player in World Cup history to net a hat trick in the final. A final that <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1966_FIFA_World_Cup_Final" target="_blank"><span class="s1">England went on to win 4-2</span></a>.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>2500-1 </strong>Costa Rica is the happiest nation on earth according to the <a href="http://www.happyplanetindex.org/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Happy Planet Index</span></a>. With odds of 2500-1 to win, they’ll need a lot of happy thoughts to go all the way.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Japan vs Columbia</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/japan-vs-columbia/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Jun 2014 20:00:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=176</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Unlucky #4</strong> The Japanese squad list goes from 3 to 5 as the number 4 is <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_superstitions" target="_blank"><span class="s1">considered unlucky in the country</span></a>. Four is pronounced "shi" which is the same as "death."</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>11KG</strong> In July 2010 a replica of the World Cup trophy was seized at a Columbian airport. The 14inch statue was <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/7870901/World-Cup-made-of-cocaine-seized-in-Colombia.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">made from 11 kilos of cocaine.</span></a></p>
<p class="p1"><strong>2014</strong> Japan were the first team to <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/10497458/Japan-World-Cup-2014-team-guide.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">qualify for the 2014 World Cup</span></a> back in June 2013.</p>
<p class="p1"></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Greece vs Ivory Coast</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/greece-vs-ivory-coast/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Jun 2014 20:00:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=179</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Boooooo!</strong> Greece have had <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/greece/10692448/World-Cup-2014-No-fans-no-real-stars-and-poor-form-leading-up-to-Brazil-Fernando-Santos-has-it-all-to-do.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">a hard lead up to the World Cup</span></a> with low fan attendances and large booing crowds. Let’s hope the Greeks get a better reception in Brazil.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>Goal!</strong> <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24510036" target="_blank">Salomon Kalou’s late goal</a></span> in an epic play-off against Senegal sealed their place at the finals.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>2/16</strong> Greece have <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/10497097/Greece-World-Cup-2014-team-guide.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">only qualified for two World Cup finals</span></a> (1994 and 2010) following sixteen attempts. The Greeks have only won one World Cup game (they beat Nigeria 2-1 in South Africa)</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>179</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-24 21:00:34</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-24 20:00:34</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

	<item>
				<title>Nigeria vs Argentina</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/nigeria-vs-argentina/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 Jun 2014 16:00:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=182</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>1930</strong> <i>La Selección</i> (<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" target="_blank"><span class="s1">national team</span></a>), also known as the <i>Albicelestes</i> (sky blue and whites), has appeared in four World Cup finals, including the first final in 1930, which they lost 4–2 to Uruguay</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>3-1</strong> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina%E2%80%93Brazil_football_rivalry" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Argentina’s rivalry with neighbours Brazil is a bit special</span>.</a> In 1920, Brazil fielded only seven players in protest at a critical article in an Argentinian newspaper. Argentina followed suit by dropping four of their starting XI, then beating their opponents 3-1. In 1939, Argentina walked off in dispute over a last-minute penalty, leaving Brazil to score the winner into an empty net.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Fluffy</strong> Drug-snorting, hand-balling, cigar-puffing, Castro-worshipping, ephedrine-taking wild man Diego Maradona's original nickname was 'Fluffy'.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>182</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-25 17:00:46</wp:post_date>

	<item>
				<title>Bosnia &amp; Herzegovina vs Iran</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/bosnia-herzegovina-vs-iran/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 Jun 2014 16:00:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=184</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>France 98</strong> Iran’s one finals victory was <a href="http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/98-most-politically-charged-game-world-cup-history" target="_blank"><span class="s1">arguably the most politically charged in World Cup history</span></a> - the “mother of all games”, they meet the United States in France 98. It ended 2-1 to Iran.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>1st World Cup</strong> The <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bosnia_and_Herzegovina_national_football_team" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team</span></a> have never appeared in the finals of the FIFA World Cup as an independent nation. Bosnian-Herzegovinian players were part of the Yugoslavia national football team until 1992. The breakup of Yugoslavia resulted in the formation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, which is considered distinct entity from the Yugoslavia team, which appeared eight times at the FIFA World Cup between 1930 and 1990.</p>
<p class="p1"></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Honduras vs Switzerland</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/honduras-vs-switzerland/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 Jun 2014 20:00:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=189</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Arrested</strong> Switzerland and Real Sociedad striker Haris Seferovic went out to celebrate his sides victory over Barcelona in February and ended up rowing with his girlfriend, <a href="http://www.marca.com/2014/02/23/en/football/spanish_football/1393185860.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">getting arrested</span></a> and sleeping it off (with his partner) in police cell.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>The Pitbull</strong> Honduran midfielder Jorge Aarón Claros Juárez is known as ‘The Pitbull’ due to his strength. In 2011 Claros was <a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2004522/Celtic-transfer-hopeful-Jorge-Claros-shot-Honduras.html" target="_blank"><span class="s1">shot in the head</span></a> after thieves failed to steal his car. He was back playing for Club Deportivo Motaguahis after 15 days out.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>40ºC</strong> Heat at the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austria_v_Switzerland_(1954)" target="_blank"><span class="s1">1954 World Cup quarter final between Austria and Switzerland</span></a> was so intense (40ºC) that one player got hyperthemia - the opposite of hypothermia - while another became disoriented and wandered off the pitch during the game. Austria ended up winning the game 7-5 (a World Cup record).</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Ecuador vs France</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/ecuador-vs-france/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 Jun 2014 20:00:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=191</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Les Bleus</strong> All staff at the JP Hotel in Ribeirao Preto have been taking French lessons since news broke that <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/07/france-world-cup-2014-team-guide" target="_blank"><i>Les Bleus </i></a>would be staying there<i>. </i>The team have requested that shower gel be placed in all bathrooms as players are “not used to blocks of soap”.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>#11</strong> Ecuador managed qualification despite the <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23492978" target="_blank"><span class="s1">tragic death of former Birmingham striker Christian “Chucho” Benitez</span></a>. Ecuador have retired his number 11 jersey in respect of the young popular player.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><strong>3-2</strong> <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24907601" target="_blank">France secured their place in Brazil</a></span> after becoming the first European team to overturn a 2-0 first-leg deficit to reach the World Cup with a 3-0 victory over 10-man Ukraine. Sakho and Benzema bagged the all important goals.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>feature_0_object</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<p class="p1">France secure their place in Brazil with a thrilling 3-0 victory over Ukraine:</p>

	<item>
				<title>Portugal vs Ghana</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/portugal-vs-ghana/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Jun 2014 16:00:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=193</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>VIP</strong> <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/07/portugal-world-cup-2014-team-guide" target="_blank">The Portugal team</a> will be staying at The Palms boutique hotel during their stay. Not only have they forced all staff to sign contracts banning any autograph requests but they have requested that Christiano Ronaldo have his own VIP suite complete with chamomile scented pillows, six bodyguards and heated mirrors that don’t steam up.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>7-3</strong> <a href="http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/teams/team=43860/matches.html" target="_blank">Ghana</a> were the top scorers in qualifying (25) and beat Egypt 7-3 over two legs.</p>
<p class="p1"><a href="http://www.express.co.uk/sport/worldcup2014/446988/World-Cup-2014-Team-Profile-Portugal" target="_blank">Portugal <span class="s1">struggled in the qualification stages</span></a> and were held to unexpected draws with Northern Ireland and Israel, and forced to the play-off after losing Group F’s top spot to Russia. They qualified after beating Sweden in the play-offs.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>USA vs Germany</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/usa-vs-germany/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Jun 2014 16:00:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=195</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>28 games</strong> USA have been to nine World Cup finals and were semi-finalists in the first World Cup in 1930. <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/06/jurgen-klinsmann-usa-coach-world-cup" target="_blank">In total they’ve played 28 games</a>, won 7, drawn 5 and lost 17.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Speeding</strong> Germany coach Joachim “Jogi” Low is a suave, black-clad, tactically astute Bryan Ferry tribute act who has <a href="http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/soccer/news/20140527/joachim-low-drivers-license-germany-manager.ap/" target="_blank"><span class="s1">lost his driving license for six months</span></a> after racking up 18 points for speeding. “I know I need to restrain myself” said Low.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>206 Goals</strong> Germany’s <a href="http://www.11v11.com/teams/germany/tab/stats/comp/978" target="_blank"><span class="s1">World Cup record</span></a> is pretty impressive: They’ve been to 17 finals, played 99 matches, been to the final 5 times, won 3 Wold Cups and scored 206 goals in the process.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
