	<item>
				<title>Korea Republic vs Belgium</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/korea-republic-vs-belgium/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Jun 2014 20:00:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=197</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><strong>Young Guns</strong> Korea Republic coach Hong Myungbo has <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/jun/06/world-cup-2014-south-korea-park-chu-young" target="_blank"><span class="s1">named a youth-orientated squad</span></a> for the 2014 World Cup, the 23-man roster features only five survivors from South Africa 2010.</p>
<p class="p1"><strong>Dark Horses</strong> Belguim aka The Red Devils cruised their way through qualification finishing a whopping nine points ahead in a group containing Croatia and Serbia. Many are tipping them as the <a href="http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2073404-why-belgium-are-the-true-world-cup-dark-horses-in-brazil" target="_blank"><span class="s1">dark horses for the tournament</span>.</a></p>
<p class="p1"><strong>11</strong> The Belguim team includes some familiar names. Eleven of their <a href="http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup-2014/belgium-football-team-world-cup-3652636" target="_blank">starting squad</a> play in the Premier League including Simon Mignolet (Liverpool), Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham), Vincent Kompany (Manchester City), Marouane Fellani (Manchester United), Moussa Dembele (Tottenham), Eden Hazard (Chelsea) and Romelu Lukaku (Chelsea).</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>197</wp:post_id>

	<item>
				<title>Algeria vs Russia</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/algeria-vs-russia/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Jun 2014 20:00:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://itskickingoff.com/?p=201</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1"><b>Two</b> Russia have only been to two World Cup finals (1994 and 2002) after the break up of the Soviet Union in 1992.</p>
<p class="p2"><strong>Manchester Paulista</strong> The Algerian team are staying in a hotel in <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sorocaba" target="_blank"><span class="s1">Sorocaba</span></a>, the eighth largest city in the stat of Sao Paulo which was once known as “Manchester Paulista” because of the number of English-owned textile factories there.</p>
<p class="p2"><strong>New boys</strong> Russia and Algeria are two of the most inexperienced teams in this years World Cup. This is only Russia's second finals and Algeria's third. Neither have got past the group stages before.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>201</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-06-26 21:00:01</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-06-26 20:00:01</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

				<title>Hello world!</title>

		<pubDate>Mon, 12 May 2014 09:56:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<description></description>

		<wp:post_id>1</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2014-05-12 09:56:47</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2014-05-12 09:56:47</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>hello-world</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>trash</wp:status>

	<item>
				<title>I am broken!</title>
		<link>http://itskickingoff.com/hello-world-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 01 Jun 2014 10:45:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost:8888/worldcup/?p=1</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>9-2</strong> Was the final score of Germany’s greatest defeat against England in 1983. <a title="Youtube Germany vs England" href="http://youtu.be/5zjJDXZwVv4" target="_blank">View the highlights on YouTube here</a>.

<strong>5-1</strong> England’s greatest defeat against Germany at a World Cup Match. View the highlights on YouTube here.

<strong>51,000</strong> Fans filled the Germany stadium last time these teams played one another.]]></content:encoded>
